definition: Houyi, mythological Chinese archer whose wife was Chang'e
empress/queen/(archaic) monarch/ruler
back/behind/rear/afterwards/after/later/post-
surname Hou
surname Yi/name of legendary archer/also written 后羿[Hou4 Yi4]

sentences.english: Houyi doesn t belong to western Yi, but eastern Yi.
sentences.chinese: 后羿属于东夷，而非西夷。

sentences.english: Houyi some magic pills that could make him live forever.
sentences.chinese: 他给了后羿一些能使他长生不老的仙丹。

sentences.english: Houyi was the chief of the western tribe of Xia dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 后羿是生活于夏王朝西方的原始部族首领。

sentences.english: Houyi i was told what was happening in the evening when he returned home from bumper hunting.
sentences.chinese: 傍晚，后羿回到家，侍女们哭诉了白天发生的事。

sentences.english: Chang'e was the wife of Houyi in ancient Chinese myths.
sentences.chinese: 嫦娥是中国古代神话传说中后羿的妻子。

sentences.english: Evening, Hou Yi got the home, the maidservants to complain tearfully the matter which the daytime occurred.
sentences.chinese: 傍晚，后羿回到家，侍女们哭诉了白天发生的事。

sentences.english: Jade Rabbit turns herself into Chang - e. to help the latter get Jiu - ge off her tracks.
sentences.chinese: 嫦娥在洛嫔的帮助下，终见到重伤的后羿。

sentences.english: He was so busy with his duties he became neglectful of his lovely and lonely wife.
sentences.chinese: 因忙于公务，后羿忽略了他可爱而寂寞的妻子。

sentences.english: Chang'e and her husband Houyi were immortals who lived in Heaven.
sentences.chinese: 嫦娥和她的丈夫后羿长生不老的生活在天上。

sentences.english: It's pity that he paid no attention to her advice.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾的是后羿没有听从王母娘娘的建议。

sentences.english: Knowing that Hou Yi came from heaven, the people of the clans proclaimed him to be their leader.
sentences.chinese: 得知后羿是玉帝所派，部落的人民推他做首领。

sentences.english: Evening, Hou Yi returned home, the maid who had cried during the day what happened.
sentences.chinese: 傍晚，后羿回到家，侍女们哭诉了白天发生的事。

sentences.english: Someone fishes in troubled water, empress Yi bow the Lue arrived air.
sentences.chinese: 有人混水摸鱼，将后羿弓掠到了空中。

sentences.english: When Ho busy firing, stealing Goose herself.
sentences.chinese: 后羿忙射日，嫦娥偷奔月。

sentences.english: Houyi shot down nine of the suns.
sentences.chinese: 后羿射下了其中的九个太阳。

sentences.english: Houyi to live forever, because he was a cruel man.
sentences.chinese: 她不想后羿长生不老，因为他是个残暴的人。

definition: Nüwa (creator of humans in Chinese mythology)
Daji (c. 11th century BC), concubine of the last Shang dynasty king Zhou Xin 紂辛|纣辛[Zhou4 Xin1]

Diaochan (-192), one of the four legendary beauties 四大美女[si4 da4 mei3 nu:3], in fiction a famous beauty at the break-up of Han dynasty, given as concubine to usurping warlord Dong Zhuo 董卓[Dong3 Zhuo2] to ensure his overthrow by fighting hero Lü Bu 呂布|吕布[Lu:3 Bu4]
Ying Zheng (260-210 BC), personal name of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]
Athena
Lu Ban, legendary master craftsman, called the father of Chinese carpentry

Jiang Ziya (c. 1100 BC, dates of birth and death unknown), partly mythical sage advisor to King Wen of Zhou 周文王[Zhou1 Wen2 wang2] and purported author of “Six Secret Strategic Teachings” 六韜|六韬[Liu4 tao1], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
Nezha, protection deity
Han Xin (-196 BC), famous general of first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1]
Wang Zhaojun (52-19 BC), famous beauty at the court of Han emperor Yuan 漢元帝|汉元帝[Han4 Yuan2 di4], one of the four legendary beauties 四大美女[si4 da4 mei3 nu:3]

Di Renjie (607-700), Tang dynasty politician, prime minister under Wu Zetian, subsequently hero of legends/master sleuth Judge Dee, aka Chinese Sherlock Holmes, in novel Three murder cases solved by Judge Dee 狄公案[Di2 gong1 an4] translated by Dutch sinologist R.H. van Gulik 高羅珮|高罗佩[Gao1 Luo2 pei4]
秦越人[Qin2 Yue4 ren2] (407-310 BC), Warring States physician known for his medical skills, nicknamed Bian Que after the earliest known Chinese physician allegedly from the 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4] era
Zhong Kui (mythological figure, supposed to drive away evil spirits)/(fig.) a person with the courage to fight against evil

Yang Yuhuan or Yang Guifei 楊貴妃|杨贵妃[Yang2 Gui4 fei1] (719-756), famous Tang beauty, consort of Emperor Xuanzhong 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1], blamed for extravagance and killed as a scapegoat during the An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]
Sun Bin (-316 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
Cheng Yaojin (589-665), aka 程知節|程知节[Cheng2 Zhi1 jie2], Chinese general of the Tang dynasty
